decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on equipping creatures with powerful artifacts such as Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes key cards like Fervent Champion and Cloud, Midgar Mercenary to create a fast and aggressive battlefield presence. By utilizing Sigarda's Aid and Kazuul's Toll Collector, the deck can quickly equip artifacts at instant speed, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Surge of Salvation provides additional ways to buff creatures and ensure the deck maintains its aggressive strategy throughout the game.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to establish board control and card advantage through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to control the game tempo by disrupting the opponent's game plan while setting up its win conditions, such as planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in the deck building process. Overall, the deck excels at outlasting opponents and grinding out incremental advantages until it can secure a victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cheap spells like Burst Lightning and Academic Dispute, along with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to deal damage fast and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Boomerang Basics and Reckless Rage provide additional removal and disruption options to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck's mana base is carefully selected to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on low-cost, aggressive creatures and cheap spells to quickly bring down the opponent's life total. The deck includes cards that can deal direct damage to creatures or players, along with creatures that benefit from casting spells. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and control the board with a mix of burn spells and creatures that can grow in size. The mana base includes lands that provide both red and blue mana to ensure you can cast your spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Crumbling Vestige to get Lotus Field into play, which provides a massive mana boost. The goal is to then combo off with cards like Scapeshift and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes cards like Aftermath Analyst and Stock Up to help dig for combo pieces and maintain card advantage. The deck utilizes lands like Port of Karfell and Boseiju, Who Endures to further enhance its combo potential and protect key pieces.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by utilizing versatile cards like Mutavault and Brightclimb Pathway, and generating advantage through cards like Pest Control and Preacher of the Schism. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Bleachbone Verge and Godless Shrine.

The main concept of this Simic Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and card advantage. The deck utilizes creatures with strong abilities like Badgermole Cub and Mockingbird, along with mana acceleration provided by Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves. Quantum Riddler and Spider Manifestation provide additional value while Nature's Rhythm helps ramp into larger threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes interaction cards like Cyclonic Rift and Stock Up to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to build a board presence quickly and apply relentless pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using powerful combo interactions to quickly reanimate big threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It utilizes cards like Bringer of the Last Gift and Superior Spider-Man to set up the combo pieces, with support from cards like Ardyn, the Usurper and Fatal Push to control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive reanimation strategy, while also having disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Fear of Missing Out to disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to establish control over the game by using a variety of counter and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw and card selection tools to help find key pieces of the strategy. With powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and versatile removal spells like Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, eventually leading to a win through attrition and superior card advantage. The companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive cards to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents for extra card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through attrition, while also being able to generate advantage through card draw and selection. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining board control and denying the opponent key resources to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate powerful value and create a board presence that is difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck includes cards that help control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategies, and ramp up mana, allowing the player to set up their combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature tokens and powerful threats like Skysovereign, Consul Flagship and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Duress helps the player disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect their own combo.

The main idea of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost spells and creatures, dealing damage consistently and efficiently. By using cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger alongside burn spells like Torch the Tower and Boomerang Basics, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain tempo throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Experimental Synthesizer allows for additional card draw and flexibility in combat, making this deck a formidable force in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cheap aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger alongside powerful burn spells like Monstrous Rage and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to deal significant damage early in the game. Academic Dispute, Boomerang Basics, and Experimental Synthesizer provide additional versatility and disruption, while cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Stormchaser's Talent help maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to both red and blue mana sources to ensure smooth gameplay.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It seeks to outlast opponents and grind out wins through efficient use of resources. The deck includes card draw and search effects to ensure it has the answers needed to handle any threats that may come its way. With the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard providing additional synergy and support, this deck aims to control the board and dictate the pace of the game until it can secure victory.

The deck focuses on early aggression and disruption, using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria to slow down opponents while deploying efficient threats like Skyclave Apparition and Knight of Autumn. Collected Company provides additional card advantage and the ability to surprise opponents with additional threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for the deck to play a mix of aggressive and disruptive creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, high-impact creatures and spells. Utilizing cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, combined with burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By maintaining pressure on the opponent and controlling the board with cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Boomerang Basics, the deck can secure victory before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The key strategy is to stay aggressive and maintain a fast pace throughout the game.
